intro: Gymnosphaera impolita var. impolita, commonly known as the rough gymnosphaera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Capparaceae. It is characterized by its rugged, woody stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are typically borne in dense inflorescences. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
